ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GRAPE 1 DRF (Doppler Radio Frequency Receiver for the Great Radio Amateur Propagation Experiment) at Grape32 station
ResourceHeader.Description:
GRAPE 1 DRF (Doppler Radio Frequency Receiver for the Great Radio Amateur Propagation Experiment) is a citizen science instrument that receives HF time-standard signals (e.g., WWV, WWVH, CHU) to measure Doppler shifts caused by ionospheric dynamics. Data is collected by volunteers using software-defined radios and GPS-disciplined oscillators, recorded in Digital RF (DRF) format, and contributed to the HamSCI Personal Space Weather Station (PSWS) repository for space weather research.
The Grape32 is located at 37.188ºN, 93.292ºW. Instrument type is Grape 1 DRF (Grape32). Antenna elevation is 300.0 degree. There is two antennas at this station, which are Antenna 1: Shielded Loop and Antenna 2: 80 meter 1/2 wave horizontal loop. It records WWV 5MHz Doppler Shift (from 2023-08-23 to 2023-09-03) and WWV 10MHz Doppler Shift (from 2023-09-04 to present).

OperatingSpan.Note: WWV 10MHz data are current to within about two days.
